conclusion: Understand the capacitor configuration with charges +Q and -Q and distance d.
Calculate electric field E using E = Q/(ε₀A) and E = V/d.
Find potential difference V using V = Q/C.
Substitute V = Q/C into E = V/d to get E = Q/(Cd).
Calculate force F on charge q using F = qE.
Substitute E = Q/(Cd) into F = qE to get F = q(Q/(Cd)).
